Data Structures

class  SmoothScrollInfo

Detailed Description

Obsolete - use the class ItemGrid instead, as it allows in an easier but more flexible way to create a listbox without the need to derive a subclass.

ScrollBehavior AbstractListBox::GetScrollBehavior (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
The scrollbehavior defined in GuiEngineConfig::GetScrollBehavior, which represents the default scroll-behavior. This method may be overwritten when another scrollbehavior is wanted.

INT AbstractListBox::GetSelectedIndex (   )  const
 

Returns:
Index of the selected listbox item.

const AbstractListBox::SmoothScrollInfo * AbstractListBox::GetSmoothScrollInfo (   )  const
 

Returns information about the smooth scrolling. 0 is returned if smooth scrolling is not enabled.

void AbstractListBox::IndicateSelectionChanged (   )  [protected]
 

Invokes OnSelectionChanged and sends the message SelectionChangedMsg to the parent-window of the control.

BOOLEAN AbstractListBox::IsFocusPassingEnabled (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns, whether to focus is passed to another control, if the selection exceeds the top or the bottom of the listbox.

Returns:
TRUE, if the position-indicator should be shown corresponding to the display-policy defined in OptionalConfig.

void AbstractListBox::SetBehavior (  Behavior  behavior  ) 
 

Obsolete - behavior is defined in GuiEngineConfig and shared by all controls for a consistent user interface.

void AbstractListBox::SetFirstVisibleIndex (  INT  index  ) 
 

void AbstractListBox::SetFocusPassingEnabled (  BOOLEAN  flag  )  [inline]
 

If flag is set to TRUE, the focus is passed to another control, if the selection exceeds the top or the bottom of the listbox. Per default the focus-passing is disabled.

void AbstractListBox::SetItemCount (  INT  item_count  ) 
 

Parameters:
item_count Number of listbox items.

void AbstractListBox::SetItemHeight (  XYDIM  item_height  )  [inline]
 

Sets the height for each item of the listbox. If no height is assigned, the default-height from the View is used.

void AbstractListBox::SetNoOfItems (  INT  item_count  )  [inline]
 

Obsolete - use SetItemCount instead.
